quest.name: The Croak Queen
journal: Cid looks expectantly in your direction.

With Biggs and Wedge not expected to report back for some time, Cid proposes that you move ahead with the tests. Your next opponent, Delta III, is apparently a being known as Halicarnassus, which Nero reveals to be the antagonist from a tale dating back to the Fourth Astral Era. Hearing this, Cid expresses surprise at the thought that Omega is deriving its subjects from works of fiction, at which moment Midgardsormr manifests to provide some timely insight. Omega, the Father of Dragons explains, has no soul and is therefore incapable of imagination; be it from fact or fiction, it must draw upon historic material in order to create. While the revelation excites Nero, it gives Cid a moment's pause, but he sets his questions aside in favor of focusing on the task at hand: defeating Halicarnassus. As has now become traditional, Alpha is waiting patiently for your signal to proceed.

※In the event that you leave the Interdimensional Rift, you may re-enter by speaking with the Ironworks hand at the Yawn.

Alpha kwehs to you his readiness to enter the Deltascape. Once your own preparations are in order, you may step through the portal to do battle with Halicarnassus.

※Deltascape V3.0 can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

In the Deltascape, you confront Halicarnassus, the flamboyant and formidable Queen of Dimension Castle. Yet all her pomp and pageantry avails her naught as you succeed in dethroning her, your victory and her demise a recreation of the ages-old tale.

With each new foe more dangerous than the last, Cid seems especially glad of your safe return. Thanks to your tireless efforts, but one test subject remains in the Deltascape. Take what rest you may, lest your next encounter prove a battle too far.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: It would seem a shame to squander the momentum we have generated...and you are fighting fit.

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorrowday to you, madamsir. Will you be descending into the Yawn?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter the Interdimensional Rift?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I doubt we'll be hearing from Biggs and Wedge for a while yet. Shall we push on here in the meantime?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Reliable as ever. Without further ado, then, let us move things along.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: According to the analysis, your next opponent, Delta III, is a being named Halicarnassus.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Halicarnassus, you say? The Queen of Dimension Castle?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What's this? You know of her?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: You mean you don't? Well, I suppose a blue-blooded brat such as you would have no interest in humble folktales.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: <sigh> It appears a lesson is in order. Halicarnassus is a character from an ancient fable. In the tale, she is one of the chief antagonists, and as such things are wont to unfold, she meets her end at the hands of the heroes─incurably valiant youths not unlike our adventurer friend here.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Literary historians have speculated that the tale could be loosely based on events which took place in the Fourth Astral Era, but little remains of that age, and there is no way to verify the claim. Indeed, most now assume the story to be a work of pure fiction.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...You mean to tell me that Omega is populating its grand experiment with fictional characters?

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem your understanding is yet lacking. Scant grasp have I of that which men know and know not...

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Mark me, then. Omega hath no soul. No mind's eye in which to envision a rival.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: To bring forth new life, it must needs draw upon that which hath already been─its every creation being another's conception.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: This limitation is concealed by the breadth of its experience. It possesseth the means to retain the knowledge of entire eras─and not only of this reflection. Yet it perceiveth not this knowledge as we do.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Fact...fiction...the distinction holdeth no meaning for Omega. All is equal in its eyes. If a thing is logical, it can be created.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Hahaha! That such a wondrous weapon should exist!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: It surpasses my wildest imaginings, and they were wild indeed!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: But I gather not everyone shares my excitement. What's the matter, Garlond? Lost your nerve?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Quiet, Nero. We adults are thinking.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...But mayhap now is not the time. Forename said shehe was ready to continue, and so am I. Let's deal with Halicarnassus.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: My musings will keep. For now, we should concentrate on defeating Halicarnassus.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: So dangerous─and wondrous─a thing cannot well be left alone. We must reach Omega, no matter the cost.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh? Kweh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alpha appears eager to proceed. You may enter Deltascape V3.0 whenever you are ready.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh? Kweh!

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kw...kwibbit?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: So that was Halicarnassus. I must congratulate Omega on her appearance. She looked exactly as I imagined her.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Though, if I were to pick fault, it did take certain liberties with her character. The queen of the tale was rather more restrained.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'm glad you're safe, Forename. For a moment there, I feared you might croak.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Forgive me. You deserve better than that. Thanks to you, we are but one victory away from clearing the Deltascape. Take as much rest as you need, old friend. You've earned it.
